comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/77199267@N03] The flag looks as if it could be the Red Ensign or 'red duster'. It is used by the British Merchant Navy and also allowed for civilian use. The 'Blue Ensign' is Admiralty use only. On the OSNI Hysterical(sic) map the grass roofed building is marked as an Ice House. The hotel with the flag out front is the Seabank on Bath Terrace. More old photo's .here Portneen is name of cove where slip is. Port being the Irish for 'bank' and 'een' small

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
As the Actress said to the Bishop Limerick In Portrush, the Actress one day Said, "Bishop, some things which I say Are quite misconstrued As lewd, crude, or rude - My meanings go often astray!"
The Bishop replied, "Oh, my Dear! You really have little to fear - . It's all in the mind Of people unkind - Come closer and sit with me here." The Actress became a bit moody - "I need some fresh air and some food. We Could stroll on the Pier - Ice-cream, Bishop dear? Perhaps we could play Punch and Judy!"
